title: Stig of the dump
author: Clive King
blurb: Eight-year-old Barney falls into a disused chalk-pit where he meets Stig who lives in a cave.  Together, they enjoy a series of adventures.

title: Beware of the storybook wolves
author: Lauren Child
blurb: When two wolves escape one night from his fairy tale book and threaten to eat him, Herb enlists the reluctant help of Cinderella's fairy godmother.

title: The mane event
author: adapted by Perdita Finn ; based on the screenplay by Meghan McCarthy
blurb: The Equestria Girls participate in a battle of the bands and soon realize it is more than a friendly competition.

title: Beware the werepup and other stories
author: Julie Sykes ; illustrated by Nathan Reed
blurb: A collection of four stories featuring Max who sets up a pet-sitting business of unusual pets and their off-the-wall adventures.

title: The adventures of Tom Sawyer
author: Mark Twain ; introduced by Richard Peck ; illustrations by Neil Reed
blurb: The adventures and pranks of a mischievous boy growing up in a Mississippi River town in the early nineteenth century.

title: The mystery of the clockwork sparrow
author: Katherine Woodfine
blurb: You are cordially invited to attend the grand opening of Sinclair's Department Store. Enter a world of bonbons, hats, perfumes and mysteries around every corner. Wonder at the daring theft of the priceless Clockwork Sparrow! Tremble as the most dastardly criminals in London enact their wicked plans! Gasp as our bold heroines, Miss Sophie Taylor and Miss Lilian Rose, break codes, devour iced buns and vow to bring the villains to justice ... A splendid adventure awaits you --

title: Once upon a dork.
author: Rachel Renee Russell with Nikki Russell and Erin Russell
blurb: After a bump on the head, Nikki has a wild dream in which she, her BFF's Chloe and Zoey, her crush Brandon, and mean girl Mackenzie all end up playing the roles of some familiar classic fairy tale characters. Will Nikki's dream turn into a nightmare?

title: I'm too fond of my fur!
author: Geronimo Stilton ; [illustrations by Larry Keys]
blurb: Geronimo follows clues in a diary all the way to Mouse Everest in search of his old friend Professor von Volt who has mysteriously disappeared.

title: Elko, Lord of the Sea
author: by Adam Blade ; cover and inside illustrations by Steve Sims
blurb: Tom must battle the ocean-dwelling monster Elko to fulfill his quest.

title: Charlie and the chocolate factory
author: Roald Dahl ; illustrated by Quentin Blake
blurb: Each of five children lucky enough to discover an entry ticket into Mr. Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory takes advantage of the situation in his own way.

title: The true gift
author: Patricia MacLachlan ; illustrated by Brian Floca
blurb: While spending Christmas at their grandparents' farm, Lily becomes convinced that her younger brother Liam is right about White Cow being lonely and helps him seek a companion for the cow, leaving little time for Christmas preparations or reading.

title: Moon rising
author: by Tui T. Sutherland
blurb: When Moonwatcher, a young NightWing with secret powers, begins school at the academy started by the dragonets of destiny after the end of the war, she soon realizes that someone is attacking the students. Moon must choose whether to help or continue to hide her gifts

title: Escaping peril
author: by Tui T. Sutherland
blurb: Peril is possibly the most dangerous dragon in Pyrrhia, because she has firescales that can kill an opponent with a touch, but now she has a mission--find her former queen, Scarlet, who is threatening the Jade Mountain Academy, and then stop her, and she is not sure if the persistent SeaWing, Turtle, who is accompanying her, will be a help or a hindrance.

title: Chester's story
author: by Sarah Hawkins ; [illustrations, Sharon Rentta]
blurb: Jessica's new lurcher puppy from the Battersea Dogs & Cats Home, Chester, is so smart that he gets in a lot of trouble, but he comes to Jessica's rescue when she accidentally locks herself in the basement.  Includes information about the real Battersea Dogs & Cats Home and pet-themed puzzles.

title: Disasters
author: David Burnie ; [illustrator, Tim Loughhead]
blurb: Takes a close-up look at some of nature's biggest disasters including tornadoes, hurricanes, earthquakes, volcacnic eruptions, floods, tsunamis, wildfires, and pandemics.

title: Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair
author: written by G. M. Berrow
blurb: Fluttershy is shocked to discover that her pet bunny, Angel, wants to enter the annual Fine Furry Friends Fair herding contest! Who's ever heard of a bunny herding cows and sheep? Fluttershy agrees to train him, but their first practice is a disaster. Fluttershy is too afraid of failure to continue, until all her friends bring something special to help out

title: My totally secret diary.
author: Dee Shulman
blurb: Polly Price records her woes in her diary after her difficult mother invites a television crew to film in their house.

title: The kitten with no name
author: Vivian French ; illustrated by Selina Young
blurb: A story of a lost little kitten, that doesn't have a name or a home. Will he be able to find a place that is warm and where someone will love him?

title: Jogger's big adventure
author: Francesca Simon ; illustrated by Emily Bolam
blurb: When the door to his cage suddenly opens, Jogger enjoys exploring his new world until the cat discovers that Jogger is roaming freely around the house.

title: Look at me
author: Francesca Simon ; illustrated by Emily Bolam
blurb: The pond has frozen over and skating is fun for everyone except for Honey the puppy. All that slipping and sliding! What is she going to do?--Back cover.

title: Sleeping beauty
author: written and illustrated by Sally Gardner
blurb: A retelling of the traditional tale in which a wicked fairy, enraged at not being invited to the princess' christening, casts a spell that dooms the princess to sleep for one hundred years.

title: Miawo miaow bow wow
author: Francesca Simon ; illustrated by Emily Bolam
blurb: Dizzy the dog loves to sing, but the mean old Alley Cats won't let him join their chorus. What do cats know about singing anyway? It's time to show them just what the dogs can do!--Back cover.

title: Blood and guts and rats' tail pizza
author: Vivian French ; illustrated by Chris Fisher
blurb: Hank can't work out where all his customers have gone. When he finds them all at a newly opened cake shop, sitting at tables and sipping tea, he can't believe it! He's got to find a way to win his customers back. But how?

title: Down in the jungle
author: Vivian French ; illustrated by Selina Young
blurb: It is bedtime for Monkey, who is not tired, and instead sets off to find a story.

title: Cinderella
author: written and illustrated by Sally Gardner
blurb: A young girl who is forced to work for her ugly stepsisters gets a chance to go to the ball with the help of her fairy godmother.

title: The haunted house of Buffin Street
author: Francesca Simon ; illustrated by Emily Bolam
blurb: When Fang and Honey's people decide to move out of Buffin Street, everyone is very upset. What can they do to stop them? Millie the cat has a clever idea...

title: Yum yum
author: Francesca Simon ; illustrated by Emily Bolam
blurb: Lola the cat is fed up of eating the same old stuff for dinner. There has to be better food out there somewhere, and she's off to find it...--Back cover.

title: Miley the stylist fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: NONE

title: Amber the orange fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows ; illustrated by Georgie Ripper
blurb: NONE

title: Twirling tails
author: Sue Bentley ; illustrated by Angela Swan
blurb: NONE

title: Jessie the lyrics fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: NONE

title: Sparkling steps
author: Sue Bentley ; illustrated by Angela Swan
blurb: A magic kitten helps Olivia combat the jealousy of her ballet school classmates.

title: School of mischief
author: Sue Bentley ; illustrated by Angela Swan
blurb: Julie, the new girl in town, overcomes her loneliness when she befriends and agrees to hide Storm, a magic wolf disguised as an Old English Sheepdog puppy, until he is ready to challenge his pack rival.

title: Tall
author: Jez Alborough
blurb: Bobo, a small chimp who wishes he were tall, learns with the other animals that his size is just right.

title: Party dreams
author: Sue Bentley ; illustrated by Angela Swan
blurb: NONE

title: Littlenose the magician
author: John Grant ; illustrations by Ross Collins
blurb: In the title work, Littlenose, a curious young boy who lives in a cave, wears clothes of fur, and has a pet woolly mammoth named Two-Eyes, tries to become a magician, but it does not come as easily as he thought it would.

title: Waffle hearts
author: Maria Parr ; translated from Norwegian by Guy Puzey
blurb: Nine-year-olds Trille and Lena, neighbours and best friends, enjoy a series of escapades, from putting a cow in a boat to advertising for a father.

title: Harry Potter and the half-blood prince
author: by J.K. Rowling ; illustrations by Mary GrandPré
blurb: Novice wizard Harry Potter, now sixteen years old, begins his sixth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in the midst of the battle between good and evil, which has heated up with the return of the Dark Lord Voldemort.
tags: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry (Imaginary organization)

title: Shark alert
author: by Davy Ocean ; illustrated by Aaron Blecha
blurb: Harry's seen a scary great white shark just off the coast of Shark Point! But when he raises the alarm, it turns out to be a silly old basking shark. After a couple more minnow-sized mistakes, Harry sees a real great white ...and it's hungry. Can he convince his neighbours to believe him before it's too late? The fourth in this hilarious series based on the character of Harry Hammer, a young hammerhead shark making a big splash on Shark Point.

title: Fitter, faster, funnier football!
author: Michael Cox ; illustrated by Miguel Francisco
blurb: A collection of trivia and humorous stories about soccer.

title: Gryph the Feathered Fiend
author: by Adam Blade
blurb: The frozen wastelands of Freeshor are a cruel place, and now a monstrous bird with feathers as sharp as blades is terrorising the land! Tom and Elenna face a deadly battle in an arctic world.

title: River rescue
author: by Summer Waters
blurb: When Antonia discovers her best friend Cai is leaving Sandy Bay she is devastated, and Cai must decide whether to give up Silver Dolphins for a city life or return to Australia with his parents, and meanwhile Sea Watch tries to save a stranded whale.

title: Rainbow rocks
author: adapted by Perdita Finn ; based on the screenplays by Amy Keating Rogers, Cindy Morrow, Natasha Levinger, and Josh Haber
blurb: The Equestria Girls wants to start a band in time for the Spring Fling.

title: Quest for justice
author: by Sean Fay Wolfe
blurb: New players join the game Minecraft every day. But dark forces are at work on the Elementia server, and when Stan, Kat, and Charlie arrive on the scene, they quickly find themselves in peril. The King has passed a law banishing all lower-level players from the server by the next Proclamation Day. Anyone who tries to help the noobs will be silenced. With the natural forces of the game closing in and the King's deadline approaching, Stan Kat, and Charlie must work together to unravel the mysteries of Elementia and lead the battle for justice--Back cover.

title: The adventures of Tom Sawyer
author: Mark Twain
blurb: Tom Sawyer, a spirited boy growing up in a Mississippi River town in the nineteenth century, tries a new method for curing warts, witnesses a murder, runs away to an island and pretends to be a pirate, watches his own funeral, and falls for the new girl in the neighborhood.

title: Frankie the make-up fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: Frankie the make-up Fairy's magical clef necklace helps keep face paint colourful and fun. But now mean Jack Frost has stolen the clef, and everyone at the Rainspell Island Music Festival will look terrible unless Kirsty and Rachel can get it back!--P. [4] of cover.

title: Una the concert fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: Kirsty and Rachel are in for a surprise when their fairy friends whisk them off to the Fairyland Music Festival, only for Jack Frost and his goblins to strut onto the stage! The naughty gang have stolen the Pop Star Fairies' magical clef necklaces, and Jack Frost intends to use them to become the biggest star in the world. Una is the fairy in charge of all concerts. But Jack Frost's goblins have stolen her magical clef, and unless Rachel and Kirsty can get it back, the climax of the Rainspell Island Music Festival will be a total flop!

title: Rochelle the star spotter fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: NONE

title: Vanessa the dance steps fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: Kirsty and Rachel are in for a surprise when their fairy friends whisk them off to the Fairyland Music Festival, only for Jack Frost and his goblins to strut onto the stage! The naughty gang have stolen the Pop Star Fairies' magical clef necklaces, and Jack Frost intends to use them to become the biggest star in the world.

title: Daisy's story
author: by Jane Clarke ; [illustrations, Artful Doodlers]
blurb: Sophie and her family choose to adopt Daisy, a Border collie puppy, to bring home as a friend for their Labrador, Morris, but Daisy is terrified of Morris.

title: Burglar Bill
author: Janet & Allan Ahlberg
blurb: Burglar Bill decides to change his way after he becomes a victim of burglary.

title: Mrs. Honey's hat
author: written and illustrated by Pam Adams
blurb: Every day a different creature removes an item from Mrs. Honey's large and outlandish hat, leaving behind something new in its place, so that by the end of the week she has an entirely new hat.

title: Gregory Cool
author: Caroline Binch
blurb: When he goes to visit his grandparents and his cousin, Lennox, on the island of Tobago, Gregory misses home at first, but as he gets to know both the island ways and his relatives, Gregory begins to enjoy himself.

title: Adele the singing coach fairy
author: by Daisy Meadows
blurb: Kirsty and Rachel are in for a surprise when their fairy friends whisk them off to the Fairyland Music Festival, only for Jack Frost and his goblins to strut onto the stage! The naughty gang have stolen the Pop Star Fairies' magical notes, and Jack Frost intends to use them to become the biggest star in the world In this second book of the magical series, the girls must help Adele the Singing Coach Fairy to get her clef back, so singers everywhere have the confidence to perform!

title: Sita, snake-queen of speed
author: Franzeska G. Ewart ; illustrated by Helen Bate
blurb: Yosser and Kylie decide that Kylie's father's prize ferret--Thunderball Silver the Third--is their ticket to earning enough money to experience the best ride at Thrill City, but in order to collect they must find it before the Grand Ferret Championships.

title: Little Fred Riding Hood
author: Michael Cox ; [illustrations] Liz Million
blurb: Wilf Wolf, who loves Little Red Riding Hood but is missing the final pages from his edition, meets a boy named Little Fred who is wearing a red hood, and when Wilf forms a plan to eat Fred's grandmother, he is shocked to find Granny to be six feet tall.

title: The glow-worm who lost her glow
author: by William Bedford ; illustrated by Sophie Joyce
blurb: Georgina the glowworm starts out on a journey to find her lost glow. Includes facts about the concepts of light and dark.

title: Flora the fairy
author: Tony Bradman ; [illustrated by] Emma Carlow
blurb: Some fairy magic helps Flora overcome her fear of Rufus the cat when she goes to visit her Grandma and Grandpa.

title: The cat who wanted to go home
author: Jill Tomlinson ; pictures by Paul Howard
blurb: Suzy the cat finds herself high in the sky without a way home after wandering onto a hot air balloon.

title: Short and scary!
author: Louise Cooper
blurb: NONE

title: Short too!
author: Kevin Crossley-Holland
blurb: A collection of more than forty short stories.

title: Short and spooky!
author: Louise Cooper
blurb: Short and Spooky! includes stories of ghosts of all kinds - some funny, some scary, some shocking-but all guaranteed to give a scare!

title: Kidnapped
author: Jan Burchett and Sara Vogler ; illustrated by Leo Hartas
blurb: NONE

title: Stinky space race
author: written by Tim Collins ; illustrations and cover design by Joëlle Dreidemy
blurb: There's a new boy in Colin's class. Harry is strangley neat and spends a lot of time in a bin at the back of school. When Colin investigates, lights flicker and the bin begins to hum, This is no ordinary bin--it can travel through time and space. Colin's day is about to turn cosmic!--Back cover.

title: The double-cross
author: Jan Burchett and Sara Vogler ; illustrated by Leo Hartas
blurb: Captain Blade's sworn enemy, Blackheart, has captured the Sea Wolf and stranded the crew. Can Sam and his captain regain their ship and play a trick on Blackheart at the same time?--Back cover.

title: The gorilla who wanted to grow up
author: Jill Tomlinson ; pictures by Paul Howard
blurb: Pongo, a little gorilla, loves playing with his friend Zambi, but he takes on more responsibility when his mother has a baby, and it is not long before his father is looking to him to take over as leader of the troop.

title: Polly's absolutely worst birthday ever
author: written by Frances Thomas ; illustrated by Sally Gardner
blurb: At the time of Polly's ninth birthday, she has chicken pox and her pet hamster dies, but a rescheduled party and new pets make her feel much better.

title: Horrid Henry's nits
author: Francesca Simon ; illustrated by Tony Ross
blurb: NONE

title: Iggy Peck, architect
author: by Andrea Beaty ; illustrated by David Roberts
blurb: Ever since he was a baby, Iggy Peck has built towers, bridges, and buildings, which comes in handy when his second grade class is stranded on an island during a picnic.

title: Goldilocks and the three bears
author: [illustrations,] Sebastien Braun
blurb: While walking in the woods, a mischievous little girl finds the house of three bears and helps herself to their food, chairs, and beds.

title: Chimp and Zee
author: [pictures by] Catherine and [text by] Laurence Anholt
blurb: Two cheeky monkeys, Chimp and Zee, go shopping in Jungletown with Mumkey after they ate all her bananas, but when Chimp and Zee get bored they decide to play hide-and-seek in Mumkey's banana basket.

title: Mindful Monkey, Happy Panda
author: story by Lauren Alderfer ; illustrations by Kerry Lee MacLean
blurb: Monkey asks Panda what he does to seem so happy and peaceful all the time, and Panda replies that he brings his attention to whatever he is doing at a given time, whether eating, walking, or resting.

title: Gladiator clash
author: Chris Blake
blurb: When Tom breaks a museum statue he releases an ancient curse. Now he must go back in time to track down six hidden amulets...On Tom's first adventure he arrives in Ancient Rome. To find the amulet, Tom will have to fight the fiercest gladiator who ever lived!--Back cover.

title: Jessame to the rescue and other stories
author: Julia Jarman ; illustrated by Duncan Smith
blurb: A collection of six short stories featuring Jessame Aduke Olusanya including one where she rescues her little brother.

title: Short!
author: Kevin Crossley-Holland
blurb: A collection of more than forty short stories.

title: Crenshaw
author: Katherine Applegate
blurb: A story about a homeless boy and his imaginary friend that proves in unexpected ways that friends matter, whether real or imaginary

title: The sword of summer
author: Rick Riordan
blurb: Magnus Chase has always been a troubled kid. Since his mother's mysterious death, he's lived alone on the streets of Boston, surviving by his wits, keeping one step ahead of the police and the truant officers. One day, he's tracked down by an uncle he barely knows-a man his mother claimed was dangerous. Uncle Randolph tells him an impossible secret: Magnus is the son of a Norse god. The Viking myths are true. The gods of Asgard are preparing for war. Trolls, giants and worse monsters are stirring for doomsday. To prevent Ragnarok, Magnus must search the Nine Worlds for a weapon that has been lost for thousands of years. When an attack by fire giants forces him to choose between his own safety and the lives of hundreds of innocents, Magnus makes a fatal decision. Sometimes, the only way to start a new life is to die ...--Publisher.

title: The white horse of Zennor
author: Michael Morpurgo
blurb: Presents a collection of five short stories of magic and strange happenings centered around Zennor, a tiny church town in Cornwall.

title: Alice's adventures in Wonderland ;
author: Lewis Carroll
blurb: A little girl falls down a rabbit hole and discovers a world of nonsensical and amusing characters.

title: Tales from a not-so-perfect pet sitter
author: Rachel Renée Russell, with Nikki Russell and Erin Russell
blurb: Nikki has to hide seven ADORKABLE puppies from two parents, one nosy little sister, an entire middle school, and one mean girl out for revenge, Mackenzie Hollister. If anyone can do it, it's Nikki--but not without some . . . challenges along the way!--Amazon.com.

title: Edward Eager's tales of magic
author: Edward Eager ; illustrated by N.M. Bodecker
blurb: A set of four novels about four cousins who travel in time and are involved with magic.

title: Big Nate blasts off
author: Lincoln Peirce
blurb: After his fight with Randy Betancourt makes headlines in the school paper, Big Nate has a problem worse than detention on his hands.

title: Esio Trot
author: Roald Dahl ; illustrated by Quentin Blake
blurb: Shy Mr. Hoppy devises a plan to win the heart of his true love by teaching her a spell to make her tortoise grow bigger.

title: The new order

blurb: Spinderella, tired of hearing the words lots and loads, longs to learn to count with real numbers, and it becomes especially important when her nine siblings decide they want to play soccer.

blurb: When his mother moves their family to the city, Frisk, an adventurous fox cub, gets excited about exploring and, instead of sleeping during the day when it is safe, he begins following a girl to school and learns about letters.

author: Lynne Rickards ; [illustrations,] Melanie Williamson
blurb: Twins Ella and Sam make everything a contest, from getting dressed in the morning to grabbing their grandmother's attention.

author: Veronika Martenova Charles ; illustrated by David Parkins

blurb: Baby Prince Frederick, lost by his nanny, is found and raised by Mrs. Cook who teaches him to bake, but when she realizes who Fred is, she takes him to the palace where he is proclaimed king, marries, and becomes the father of triplet girls.

title: Swim for your life
author: Shoo Rayner
blurb: Olly's excitement about watching the Great Swimming Race is threatened when he hears a legend of a terrible monster in the water.

author: Kate Irwin ; illustrated by Clare Elsom
blurb: After falling out with his best friend, Alfie the baboon thinks he is better off living with humans who are never mean and never argue-- or do they?

title: The cat in the coat

blurb: When Cat asks Goat to ride in his boat, Goat does not realize that Cat has something sneaky planned--OCLC.

author: [text by] Vivian French ; [illustrations by] Alison Bartlett
blurb: Bill Bird gets some new, blue boots, but he has a little trouble getting them tied and untied.

author: Pippa Goodhart ; [illustrated by] Georgie Birkett
blurb: Jo-Jo wishes she were small like her new baby sister Roo until Dad says Jo-Jo is big enough to have a birthday party with invited guests, jumping games, and hidden presents.

blurb: A retelling of the classic tale of a beautiful princess who makes a promise to a frog which she does not intend to keep.

title: Spooky soccer
author: Malachy Doyle ; [illustrations,] Garry Parsons
blurb: Seamus helps a group of fed-up ghosts form a soccer team, and they prove to be very talented.

blurb: After her brother leaves for college, Ruth's parents take her to the Battersea Dogs & Cats Home to get a rescued dog. Ruth's beagle puppy, Misty, is energetic, which gets the girl and her puppy into a lot of trouble.  Includes information about the real Battersea Dogs & Cats Home and pet-themed puzzles.

title: Race for the stars
author: Shoo Rayner
blurb: NONE

blurb: NONE

title: Grandma comes to stay
author: Ifeoma Onyefulu
blurb: Three-year-old Stephanie works hard to help get ready for a visit from Grandma and she is rewarded by special gifts only a grandmother can give.

title: T is for Turkey
author: Nilüfer Topaloğlu Pyper ; [photographs] Prodeepta Das
blurb: Contains entries that provide information about people, places, and things in Turkey's history, culture, and natural world--one for each letter of the alphabet.

title: Who loves Mr. Tubs?
author: [text by] Bel Mooney ; [illustrations by] Susan Hellard
blurb: Kitty gets a new doll for her birthday and completely forgets about her old favorite bear, Mr. Tubs, until her mother takes Mr. Tubs and gives him to Kitty's baby brother.

title: Whatnot takes charge
author: Linda Newberry ; [illustrations] Georgie Ripper
blurb: Whatnot the dog, who comes from a family of famous canines but has never won a prize himself, is entered by his owner Tim into an obedience competition, but when a loud noise frightens him, he accidentally enters the fancy dress race.

title: Hedgehogs do not like heights
author: Patricia Forde ; and Joëlle Dreidemy [illustrator]
blurb: Lola, Solomon Spider, and Fizzy Izzy are in a tree when Fizzy Izzy is turned into a hedgehog and they must find a way to get the hedgehog down.

title: Dragon magic
author: Pippa Goodhart ; [illustrated by] Lesley Danson
blurb: Huff, the dragon, has lost his fire, so Jess seeks out the old wizard to find a new young dragon.

title: Sinclair, wonder bear
author: Malorie Blackman ; [illustrated by] Deborah Allwright
blurb: Emily's stuffed bear Sinclair is a superhero, going out every night and changing himself into different materials, from steel to rubber to glass, to help people all over the world. Includes facts about materials.

title: Monster eyeballs
author: Jacqueline Wilson ; illustrated by Stephen Lewis
blurb: Kate likes nearly everything about school except for her big, bullying classmate Mark, but when their brothers Robbie and Andrew become friends, Mark ends up at Kate's house for Robbie's birthday party during which Kate learns some very useful information.

title: Diggers and dumpers
author: Valerie Wilding ; [illustrated by] Maria Maddocks
blurb: Despite small squabbles, Leo and Ben have a good time playing with their toy dump truck and backhoe.

title: Dudley's muddley day
author: Josh Webb ; illustrated by Gabriele Antonini
blurb: Dudley feels very foolish but his friends show him his heart is in the right place.

title: A dog called Whatnot
author: Linda Newbery ; [illustrated by] Georgie Ripper
blurb: Tim and Grandad are thrilled when they find a stray dog in the park, but when Tim's sister Louisa starts sneezing when the dog is around, they fear they will have to give up their new friend.

title: Matty Mouse
author: Jenny Nimmo ; illustrated by Ruth Rivers
blurb: Matty Mouse, who spends most of his time forgetting things like turning off the water and shutting the door, learns that his thinking cap is closer than he realizes.

title: Mairi's mermaid
author: Michael Morpurgo ; illustrated by Lucy Richards
blurb: Mairi has trouble learning to swim until she meets a tiny mermaid who needs her help.

title: Star of the show
author: Sue Bentley ; illustrated by Angela Swan
blurb: NONE

title: The elves and the shoemaker
author: retold by Lorna Read ; illustrated by Jan Lewis
blurb: Retelling of the Grimm fairy tale in which a poor shoemaker becomes successful with the help of two elves who finish his shoes during the night.

title: Space saver
author: Kate Agnew ; illustrations, Frances Castle
blurb: Things are going badly at Mission Control. On the far side of the moon, a wheel has fallen off the spy-camera's Moon Buggy and the astronauts can't fix it. It's up to Ben to blast into space and save the day.

title: Coconut Jack
author: written by Jill Lewis ; illustrated by Erica-Jane Waters
blurb: Jack and his friends in first grade work hard to make their jungle display the best in the school.

title: FS Geeta's day
author: Prodeepta Das
blurb: Photographs and simple text describe a young girl's day in her unique village in India.

title: FS B is for Bangladesh
author: Urmi Rahman ; [photographs] Prodeepta Das
blurb: Introduces young readers to the history, people, landscape, natural wonders, wildlife, cuisine, and religions of Bangladesh.

title: Meg's veg
author: by Helen Nicoll and Jan Pienkowski
blurb: Meg, the witch, her cat and owl, all pitch in to grow a vegetable garden.

title: Mog in the fog
author: by Helen Nicoll and Jan Pieńkowski
blurb: Climbing up a mountain, Meg the witch and Mog the cat run into thick fog and bump into something very strange.

title: Polly and the pirates
author: Tony Bradman ; illustrated by James Davies
blurb: Cap'n Caleb and Keel-Haul Annie were once the most fearsome pirates ever to sail the seven seas, but their daughter Polly has never even been to the beach! Can Polly save the day when her school trip is attacked by Bad Bart?--Back cover.

title: The three little pigs
author: based on a traditional folk tale ; retold by Nicola Baxter ; illustrated by Jan Lewis
blurb: An adaptation of the tale of The Three Little Pigs.

title: Storm
author: Kevin Crossley-Holland ; illustrated by Alan Marks
blurb: Out on an urgent errand one stormy night and apprehensive about the ghost rider who supposedly haunts her neighborhood, Annie accepts a ride from a silent man on horseback.

title: Friday surprise
author: written by Anne Fine ; illustrated by Helen Flook
blurb: Bryce is tired of tests, so he decides it is time to turn the tables on the adults in his life and make them take a test he has created.

title: The football ghosts
author: Malachy Doyle ; [illustrations by] Garry Parsons
blurb: Seamus, who loves the United soccer team and ghosts, is told by his grandfather that the scary castle up the hill has ghosts of the 1948 United and Rovers cup final teams playing at night, and when he investigates, he gets a chance to help the doomed spirits.

title: Florence Nightingirl
author: Dave Woods, Chris Inns
blurb: Florence Nightingirl wants to clean up grim fairytales with her ruthless hygiene regime! Follow her dazling quest as she clears up Rapunzel's nits, sheep-dips Mary and her little lamb, and fights germs everywhere!--Back cover.

title: Short John Silver
author: text and illustrations, Dave Woods, Chris Inns
blurb: Short John Silver sails the seven seas in search of adventure and sweets! Aaargh!--OCLC.

title: Robin Hoodie
author: text and illustrations, Dave Woods, Chris Inns
blurb: 'Tis a terrible crime! Prince John has stolen all the sweets from the children of Sherbet Forest. So it's up to brave Robin Hoodie and his Merry Boyz - Very Little John, Will Starlett, Friar Tuckshop and Maid Marionette - to get them back. Will Robin Hoodie's sweet plan go sour?--Back cober.

title: K is for Korea
author: Hyechong Chung ; [photographs by] Prodeepta Das
blurb: A photographic introduction to Korea, featuring brief descriptions of people, places, customs, and other aspects of city and country life in Korea, arranged alphabetically from Arirang to Lacquerware.

title: The gingerbread bunny
author: Jonathan Allen
blurb: A lift-the-flap variation of the familiar tale in which a gingerbread bunny escapes its bakers and runs off only to be outwitted by a sly fox.

title: Sir Lance-a-Little
author: text and illustrations, Dave Woods, Chris Inns
blurb: Sir Lance-a-Little goes on a quest where he must save a damsel, win a jousting contest, and go up against a wizard, an ogre, and a dragon.

title: Mr Tubs is lost!
author: Bel Mooney ; [illustrated by] Margaret Chamberlain
blurb: Accidentally left in the woods by his owner, Mr. Tubs the teddy bear meets many woodland creatures, some who are kind and some who are scary.

title: New friend, old friends
author: Julia Jarman ; illustrated by Kate Pankhurst
blurb: Phoebe, Daisy and Erika are very excited - a new girl is joining their class! But when Shazia starts school, the three girls compete to be her friend. Shazia comes from Pakistan and everything is new for her. She is eager to fit in and when her adventurous plans go wrong, the three old friends have to work together to help their new friend--Back cover.

title: A friend in need!
author: by Julia Jarman ; illustrated by Kate Pankhurst
blurb: Erika is good at sports, actually she's good at everything, and she has loads of friends. But her two best friends Daisy and Phoebe are worried about her--she seems really quiet and is avoiding them. If it wasn't Erika they'd be worried she was being bullied, but surely no one would bully the most popular girl in school?--Back cover.

title: Make friends, break friends
author: Julia Jarman ; illustrated by Kate Pankhurst
blurb: Daisy has two best friends, Phoebe and Erika, but they don't get on. Erika thinks Phoebe's feeble, and Phoebe thinks Erika's a bully! Daisy has a plan to get her two best friends to like each other, but suddenly everyone is against her! So what happens when the three girls have to spend a night together in a spooky old mill...--Back cover.

title: Sarah, plain and tall
author: Patricia MacLachlan
blurb: When their father invites a mail-order bride to come live with them in their prairie home, Caleb and Anna are captivated by their new mother and hope that she will stay.

title: Rook
author: Anthony McGowan
blurb: YA. GENERAL FICTION (CHILDREN'S / TEENAGE). A poignant, beautifully written novella about growing up and family. A companion piece to the hugely successful Brock and Pike, McGowan warms hearts once more with the adventures of Nicky and Kenny. Particularly suitable for struggling, reluctant and dyslexic readers aged 13+. Age 13+

title: Attack of the giant robot chickens
author: Alex McCall
blurb: The city of Aberdeen is being terrorized by giant robot chickens who want to peck out every last sign of human resistance. The streets are empty, the adults have vanished - and those left behind are fighting for survival.

title: Monacello
author: written by Geraldine McCaughrean ; illustrated by Jana Diemberger
blurb: Presents a retelling of an Italian folk story, set in the dark world of Medieval Naples.

title: The ant and the grasshopper
author: based on a story by Aesop ; retold by Katie Daynes ; illustrated by Merel Eyckerman ; reading consultant, Alison Kelly, Roehampton University
blurb: A retelling of Aesop's classic fable, in which Ant and Grasshopper cannot agree on how to spend the summer.

title: The revenge of the Green Meanie
author: Alan MacDonald ; illustrated by Nigel Baines
blurb: Stand Button has no idea that he is a superhero. But after a crash course in basic skills, like where to buy superhero tights and how to keep your mask clean, Stan must face his first evil genius!--Back cover.

title: Fly away
author: Patricia MacLachlan
blurb: While in North Dakota helping her Aunt Frankie prepare for a possible flood, Lucy finds her voice as a poet with the help of her two-year-old brother Teddy, the rest of their family, and a few cows.

title: The Boxcar children beginning
author: Patricia MacLachlan ; interior illustrations by Robert Dunn
blurb: In the year before they become the orphans known as the Boxcar children, Henry, Jessie, Violet, and Benny Alden live with their parents at Fair Meadow Farm, where, although times are hard, they take in a family who has been stranded in their car during a blizzard.

title: Anne of the island
author: L.M. Montgomery
blurb: Anne is finally off to Redmond College! While she's sad to be leaving Marilla and the twins, she's excited to finally become a full-fledged BA, and to embark on new adventures with the other Avonlea folks attending Redmond, a group that includes her friend Gilbert Blythe. At Redmond Anne meets Philippa Gordon, a frivolous but charming girl who pulls Anne into the center of the Redmond social scene. As Anne becomes the object of several boys' affection, she's faced with numerous proposals she can't possibly accept. Then Gilbert ruins everything by declaring his own feelings for her, and Anne worries that she's lost one of her best friends...and possibly so much more.

title: Anne of Avonlea
author: L.M. Montgomery
blurb: In this sequel to Anne of Green Gables, teenaged Anne Shirley becomes a schoolteacher in a small village on Prince Edward Island.

title: Anne of Avonlea
author: L.M. Montgomery
blurb: In this sequel to Anne of Green Gables, teenaged Anne Shirley becomes a schoolteacher in a small village on Prince Edward Island.

title: One thousand and one Arabian nights
author: Geraldine McCaughrean ; illustrated by Rosamund Fowler
blurb: The magical tales of One Thousand and One Arabian Nights are retold with style and excitement by Carnegie Award-winning author Geraldine McCaughrean. Shahrazad's attempts to stave off execution by telling just one more story retain the flavor of a magic, jinni-ridden desert world, and McCaughrean's well-deserved reputation for rich language and gripping narrative will keep young adults enthralled.

title: Anne's house of dreams
author: L. M. Montgomery
blurb: Anne and Gilbert, finally married, move away from Avonlea to their House of Dreams, where they start their family and befriend their neighbors, the lonely Captain Jim and the tragic Leslie.

title: The jungle vampire
author: by the Beastly Boys ; illustrated by Jonny Duddle
blurb: Ulf the werewolf is training to become an official Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Beasts (RSPCB) agent, and his mission takes him to the jungle in search of a legendary jungle vampire.

title: The magnificent Moon Hare and the foul treasure
author: by Sue Monroe ; illustrated by Birgitta Sif
blurb: The magnificent Moon Hare and his friends, P.J. and a dragon named Sandra, are off on a dangerous quest to find Uncle Julian's lost treasure map.

title: Pirates 'n' pistols
author: Chris Mould
blurb: A collection of pirate stories by Chris Mould with excerpts from stories from other sources.

author: Patricia MacLachlan

author: Michael Morpurgo ; illustrated by Michael Foreman
blurb: A young boy in Spain during the Spanish Civil War, distressed to realize that Paco, the bull he has raised since its birth, is going to die in the bullring, decides to give Paco his freedom and follows the animal into the hills just in time to see his family die in a bombing raid on his farm and village.

title: The accidental secret agent
author: written and illustrated by Tom McLaughlin
blurb: Schoolboy turns secret agent in this hilarious spy spoof! Before you read this, I want you to carefully check that no-one is reading over your shoulder--go ahead, do it now. First off, that was terrible, really obvious. If I'm going to tell you top secret government information, you're going to have to be a bit more stealthy. Try again. Was anyone looking? No? Right, then I'll begin. This year the secret service made a major mix up, they mistook a 13-year-old boy called Kevin for a secret agent (I know, so much for an 'intelligence' agency). This was the sort of kid that would try and zip wire across a building and end up falling head first into a fountain with his bum on show, so can you imagine what happened when he was allowed access to the amazing sort of spy gadgets that James Bond would use? Despite this, it was up to Kevin to save us all from an evil supervillain.

The second in this hilarious series based on the character of Harry Hammer, a young hammerhead shark making a big splash on Shark Point.

title: Agatha Parrot and the floating head
author: typed out neatly by Kjartan Poskitt ; illustrated by David Tazzyman
blurb: Agatha Parrott and her friends go to Odd Street School and when Miss Barking tries to execute a student named Martha with a floppy cardboard axe, she is in for quite a surprise.

title: Agatha Parrot and the heart of mud
author: typed out neatly by Kjartan Poskitt ; illustrated by David Tazzyman
blurb: Agatha Parrot intercepts her brothers email from a girl and replies as him, and in the process gains access to words for the spelling club at school, which helps out her friend Martha.

title: My totally secret diary.
author: Dee Shulman
blurb: Polly records the details of the behind-the-scenes mishaps and mayhem that occur when she travels to America with her mother, an actress who has been signed to appear in a stage show.

title: Short and shocking!
author: Maggie Pearson
blurb: NONE

title: Diary of Dorkius Maximus in Pompeii
author: Tim Collins ; illustrated by Andrew Pinder
blurb: Dorkius Maximus is dragged by his parents to Pompeii for what he thinks is going to be a boring summer, but he discovers a secret that could put the the whole town in danger.

title: The brilliant world of Tom Gates
author: by Liz Pichon
blurb: Tom Gates is the master of excuses for late homework: dog attacks, spilt water, lightening ... Tom's exercise book is full of his doodles, cartoons and thoughts, as well as comments from his long-suffering teacher, Mr Fullerton. After gaining five merits for his 'Camping Sucks' holiday story, Tom's work starts to go downhill, which is a pity, as he's desperate to impress Amy Porter, who sits next to him ...

title: Agatha Parrot and the zombie bird
author: typed out neatly by Kjartan Poskitt ; illustrated by David Tazzyman
blurb: A magician comes to Agatha Parrot's school and makes a zombie bird pop out of a silver egg.

title: Spellbound
author: retold by Siobhán Parkinson ; illustrated by Olwyn Whelan
blurb: Seven ancient legends of Ireland, told for younger children. The stories are all linked by themes of magic and enchantment.

title: Tales from a not-so-perfect pet sitter
author: Rachel Renée Russell, with Nikki Russell and Erin Russell
blurb: Nikki has to hide seven ADORKABLE puppies from two parents, one nosy little sister, an entire middle school, and one mean girl out for revenge, Mackenzie Hollister. If anyone can do it, it's Nikki--but not without some . . . challenges along the way!--Amazon.com.

title: Samurai (series 3)
author: Stowell, Louie
blurb: NONE

title: Mummies and pyramids
author: by Will Osborne and Mary Pope Osborne ; illustrated by Sal Murdocca
blurb: An overview of ancient Egypt that covers mummies, pyramids, religion, funerals, and daily life as well as tomb discoveries and raiding.  Includes a list of museums and sources for further research.

title: Tales from a not-so-dorky drama queen
author: Rachel Renée Russell, with Nikki Russell and Erin Russell
blurb: Springtime brings crazy adventures to Nikki and her friends Chloe, Zoey, and Brandon--OCLC.

title: The house of Hades
author: Rick Riordan
blurb: Greek and Roman demigods from the Prophecy of Seven must work together to seal the Doors of Death--and help Percy and Annabeth escape the Underworld in the process
tags: JUVENILE FICTION / Legends, Myths, Fables / Greek & Roman.

title: Ottoline and the yellow cat
author: Chris Riddell
blurb: Ottoline and Mr. Munroe investigate a string of burglaries and the disappearance of several lapdogs.

title: Goth girl and the ghost of a mouse
author: Chris Riddell
blurb: Meet Ada Goth. She lives in Ghastly-Gorm Hall with her father, Lord Goth, lots of servants and at least half a dozen ghosts, but she hasn't got any friends to explore her enormous, creepy house with. Then one night everything changes when Ada meets a ghostly mouse named Ishmael. Together they set out to solve the mystery of the strange happenings at Ghastly-Gorm Hall. And get a lot more than they bargained for...--Back cover.

title: The Trials of Apollo
author: Rick Riordan
blurb: After angering his father Zeus, the god Apollo is cast down from Olympus. He must learn to survive in the modern world until he can somehow find a way to regain Zeus's favor--

author: Rick Riordan

blurb: Belle has dreamt of adventures like the ones she reads in her books, of traveling the world outside her small town. But when Belle's father is taken prisoner by a beast in an enchanted castle, her path is forever changed--Amazon.

author: Chris Riddell

title: The sword of summer
author: Rick Riordan
blurb: Magnus Chase has always been a troubled kid. Since his mother's mysterious death, he's lived alone on the streets of Boston, surviving by his wits, keeping one step ahead of the police and the truant officers. One day, he's tracked down by an uncle he barely knows-a man his mother claimed was dangerous. Uncle Randolph tells him an impossible secret: Magnus is the son of a Norse god. The Viking myths are true. The gods of Asgard are preparing for war. Trolls, giants and worse monsters are stirring for doomsday. To prevent Ragnarok, Magnus must search the Nine Worlds for a weapon that has been lost for thousands of years. When an attack by fire giants forces him to choose between his own safety and the lives of hundreds of innocents, Magnus makes a fatal decision. Sometimes, the only way to start a new life is to die ...--Publisher.

title: The jungle book
author: Rudyard Kipling
blurb: Presents the adventures of Mowgli, a boy reared by a pack of wolves, and the wild animals of the jungle.

title: The water-babies
author: Charles Kingsley
blurb: The adventures of Tom, a sooty little chimney sweep with a great longing to be clean, who is stolen by fairies and turned into a water baby.

title: Just so stories
author: Rudyard Kipling
blurb: A collection of stories that explain why animals look and act the way they do, including How the Whale Got His Throat, The Elephant's Child, The Butterfly That Stamped, and others.

title: Just so stories
author: Rudyard Kipling ; introduced by Jonathan Stroud ; illustrations by Rudyard Kipling
blurb: A collection of twelve fables and short stories by Rudyard Kipling including How the Whale got his Throat and The Elephant's Child.

title: The jungle book
author: Rudyard Kipling ; introduced by Christopher Paolini ; illustrations by Alan Langford
blurb: Mowgli, left alone in the jungle as a toddler after his parents are run off by Shere Khan, a Bengal tiger, grows to adulthood with the help of kind animals, always knowing his own showdown with the tiger is yet to come.

title: Will gallows & the snake-bellied troll
author: Derek Keilty ; illustrated by Jonny Duddle
blurb: NONE

title: Kim
author: Rudyard Kipling ; introduced by Susan Cooper
blurb: Kim, the orphaned son of an Irish soldier, grows up in India, forms a bond with a Tibetan lama, and eventually begins an exciting career in the British Secret Service.

title: Neville the Devil
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: Jiggy McCue, Angie, and Pete find their vacation ruined by Neville, who knows how to pull their strings.

title: Tales from Shakespeare
author: Charles and Mary Lamb ; introduced by Dame Judi Dench
blurb: Presents prose retellings of twenty of William Shakespeare's comedies and tragedies, including A Midsummer Night's Dream, Romeo and Juliet, and Macbeth.

title: The call of the wild ;
author: Jack London
blurb: Presents two classics by Jack London: The Call of the Wild, in which a dog in the Klondike reverts to wilderness life and becomes the leader of a pack of wolves; and White Fang, in which a wolf-dog trained to be a vicious fighter struggles to live in both the world of dogs and that of the gods, or humans.

title: Starry River of the Sky
author: Grace Lin
blurb: An innkeeper's chore boy discovers that a visitor's stories hold the key to returning the moon to the Starry River of the Sky.

title: Jiggy the vampire slayer
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: Jiggy McQue works to learn new skills to fight back against the vampires.

title: Rudie dudie
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: A new drama teacher, Ms Mooney, has arrived at Ranting Lane, Jiggy's school. She plans to put on a production of A Midsummer Night's Dream--and guess who will be chosen to play Bottom? Not only that, Ms Mooney also seems to be able to mesmerise Jiggy into doing things he really shouldn't, especially not in public.

title: Kid swap
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: NONE

title: Jiggy's magic balls
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: Jiggy's medieval life is one dirty dung heap of trouble after another and even worse, he has to work for the dumbest knight in the land, Sir Bozo de Beurk, but when Jiggy discovers a pair of magic balls, his fortunes might be about to change.

title: The curse of the Poltergoose
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: After moving to a new house Jiggy is haunted by the ghost of a goose, and his friends join him in trying to lay her spirit to rest.

title: The Snottle
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: A new girl arrives in Jiggy McCue's class whose snot can predict the future, which attracts the attention of a snot-eating creature called the Snottle.

title: The meanest genie
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: Jiggy McCue thinks his bad luck is about to turn when he is given a genie until the genie turns against him.

title: Jiggy and the witchfinder
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: In the seventeenth century, Jiggy O'Dear tries to save his grandmother from accusations that she is a witch.

title: The iron, the switch and the broom cupboard
author: Michael Lawrence
blurb: After Jiggy McCue hides in the school broom cupboard to avoid a teacher, he emerges to find himself in a parallel universe.
